name: BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich
author: Allrecipes
summary: Slow-roasted pork is shredded and mixed with a tangy barbeque sauce, then loaded into hoagie rolls and topped with homemade coleslaw. This is not a sandwich for the faint of heart!
ingredients: ¼ cup pickled pepperoncini peppers, chopped
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or more to taste
4  Italian-style hoagie buns, split lengthwise and toasted
¼ cup jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced  (Optional)
directions: Combine coleslaw mix, pepperoncini peppers, red onion, mayonnaise, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, 1 tablespoon granulated garlic, Dijon mustard, white sugar, salt, 1/2 teaspoon granulated onion, and lemon pepper in a large bowl
Cover and refrigerate until ready to use
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)

Combine kosher salt, black pepper, 2 tablespoons granulated garlic, 2 tablespoons granulated onion, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper, nutmeg, allspice, and cinnamon together in a bowl
Place pork shoulder in a large roasting pan
Rub with 1/4 cup molasses on all sides and between any crevices
Sprinkle with kosher salt seasoning mixture and rub over all sides
Cover pan tightly with heavy-duty aluminum foil and roast pork in the preheated oven until tender and a thermometer inserted reaches 200 degrees F (95 degrees C), 3 to 4 hours
Transfer pork to a cutting board, reserving pan juice, and allow to cool slightly before pulling
Using two forks, shred the pork shoulder into bite-size pieces
Transfer meat to a large bowl and toss with some of the pan juices to keep it moist
Pour reserved pan juices into a large pot over medium heat
Add barbeque sauce, coffee, 1 tablespoon molasses, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, dry mustard, and a pinch of cayenne pepper
Bring to a simmer, reduce heat, and cook for 15 minutes
Add shredded pork and stir until warm, about 5 minutes
Fill each hoagie bun with pork mixture
Garnish with 1 tablespoon onion and 1 tablespoon jalapeno
